data.title: AMAZING AMAZING!!
data.text: We go to Provo once a month to have lunch with our son at a place none of us have ever been before.  Yesterday was that day and I read reviews  and found the Black Sheep Cafe.  It was a great lunch.  My husband and son had the Bleu Cheese Burger with Rosemary Fries and the Black Sheep Burger with Sweet Potato Fries.  I had the Black Sheep Navajo Taco which is a vegan option.  We took a family friend with us who was visiting for a few days.  He also had the one of the Buffalo Navajo Tacos.  We all loved them.  The sweet potato fries were a huge hit with all of us.  We all had to sample them.  Their fry sauce was some of the best I've tasted and every food establishment in Utah as some sort of fry sauce.  Their portion sizes were pretty ample and I couldn't finish all of my entree and our family friend couldn't finish all of his.  They serve plenty of food.   It's a small restaurant but we went at 2pm and got right in and were served quickly.  I think you will enjoy your visit there as well.

data.title: Excellent food and frybread
data.text: The waitress was great and explained her favorites on the menu. I ordered the pork jowl taco ($22) and a salad with a cactus dressing ($9). Both were very tasty and I was full. Nonetheless, I got an order of frybread ($4), which comes with honey butter, and it was terrific and I was more than full.

data.title: Great little place to eat in Downtown Provo
data.text: We went as a family to eat.  We had never been here before.  It was really good.  They serve Southwestern style Native American food.  I got a breakfast burrito and other members of our family ordered different versions of Navajo Tacos. We also ordered some Basil Fries and some Sweet Potato fries as an appetizer.  You have to try the Sweet Potato fries.  The food was great and we all said we would go there again.

data.title: No black marks here!
data.text: We checked the place out the night before, and were told that several of the dishes could be made vegetarian, so we returned and enjoyed a delicious dinner of enchiladas.  They were carefully flavoured and beautifully presented and the staff were friendly and helpful.  Would definitely eat here again if we were in town.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: Easily the best brunch I've ever had. Visited on a Sunday afternoon, and enjoyed the carnitas hash and biscuits in gravy. Both were superb, and a lovely compliment to one another - the carnitas being hearty but on the lighter side, and the biscuits in gravy rich and spicy. Service was lovely and attentive.

data.title: Native American food
data.text: A great little cafe in downtown Provo.  We were seated promptly our waitress Haley was great.  We ordered the specials Pork Jowl nachos and the filet tacos both were amazing.  The meal was pricey but worth it.

data.title: Delicious food!
data.text:
Friends took us to Black Sheep and they were right, their food is delicious!
Definitely try the frybread with honey butter!
But actually everything is good!
I had the vegetarian version of the Bleu Fire Shrimp and the Enchiladas, both were really good!
Also try the sweet potato fries! 

We had a lovely night, the food was great and the stuff was really friendly\
Just eat here if you are in the neighborhood ;-)

data.title: Return trip
data.text: All expectation were meet and exceeded.  Had the surf and turf special and it was amazing!  This is my second time here and plan on a return trip next month. If you like southwest with a gourmet twist this place is for you!

data.title: High quality Southwestern comfort food
data.text: I've eaten at Black Sheep twice and their food and service was really good both times. The inventive dishes are all in a Southwestern theme. Things are flavored with discretion and no spice owns the dish, but rather multiple flavors and textures interact. Portions are fair but not bounteous.

data.title: Best Place in Provo
data.text: This is currently the best place to eat in the Provo/Orem area. I had the Chimi-rellano and it was, by far, the best thing I have ever eaten. Service is a bit slow, but they make up for it in the quality of food.

data.title: Delicious in every way!
data.text: The service is impeccable, the hostess was so warm and greeted us right off the bat. I love the atmosphere here, and the location. It feels like a chic cafe in a big modern city. The food is delivered and its a masterpiece to look at and a party to the taste buds. The buffalo nickel burger was amazing. Its a must if you visit Provo!

data.title: Unique flavors
data.text: I love finding restaurants where not only are the flavors unique, but the presentation is artistic, and The Black Sheep Cafe gets highest marks on both counts.  This restaurant features inventive flavor twists - between the three of us we had tacos, a salad, and a burger and we ended up sharing all of our plates so that we could each try everything- it was all delicious!

data.title: Nice Little Spot
data.text: Friends recommended this place so went for dinner with some friends while visiting Provo Monday night. Tried their award winning Hog Jowl Tacos. The flavored were delicious! Had a sweet coleslaw on perfectly prepared corn tortillas but very little of the pork:(. The taco flavors were amazing but the portions were small and paid $21 for 3 tacos!!!!  Didn't even come with chips and salsa and the rice and beans it did come with were just ok. We also had the Pork Enchiladas. Once again the sauce and corn tortillas were amazing but portions were small and price was way too high for what you got.

data.title: Wonderful service!
data.text: Came in with a date tonight, we were met with a wonderful welcome from the hostess as soon as we came in, and was sat right away! We had a three course meal ending in a delightful cheese cake, the kitchen does a wonderful job and the service was on-par, props the wait staff!

data.title: Unorganized
data.text: What a joke. First they told us we couldn't make reservations. I made one in front of the hostesses face and still said I didn't have one. I don't recommend this place. If they can't get reservations organized imagine how the kitchen is.

data.title: Tacos with a twist
data.text:
Provo is always a nice town to visit and wandering the downtown area I came across this unusual named restaurant, so being the try anything new kind of guy, in I went. 
The wait staff were very attentive and my server Zack explained the menu and told me the specials. I try a local pale ale beer to start with the iceberg wedge. Different to a typical blue cheese dressing, this had a mildly spicy aioli dressing that was very tasty. 
Zack recommended the chefs award winning hogs cheek tacos. Always ready to try I ordered them. I can tell you I was not disappointed. The meat with a slight barbecue sweet flavor, offset with the jalapeños and radish made my mouth water. I will be going back to this establishment for sure.

data.title: Longest wait for a cup of soup and a piece of pie ever!!!!
data.text: Couldn't even get a menu for 10 minutes.  Another 20 for my soup that I finally had them bring in a to go cup,  that was literally a paper cup without even putting a lid on it they "gently" PLACED IT STANDING UP IN A PLASTIC BAG!!!  WHAT THE HE1! IS THAT?

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: Interesting Southwest menu.  Sometimes takes a while to get fed.  Good servers and tasty!  Try the appetizers as well.

data.title: Unique
data.text: Interesting take on Southwest cuisine. Chill atmosphere, with helpful friendly staff.  Navajo flat bread tacos were yummy and huge. We had the green chile pork tacos. Asparagus and sweet potato fries were excelent sides. Don't expect a traditional taco, you will need a knife and fork. Cactus fruit lemonade was good, but a little too sweet for my personal preference. Would definitely return.

data.title: Awesome lunch
data.text: The lunch menu is amazing. The service was great and knowledgable. The blue burger was the best I have ever seen. The wedge salad was great but get the dressing on the side. The chile frites were rich and over the top. If you are hungry with choices I recommend this place!
